summary.para: The EnumStreamIdMap method returns a collection of all the mapped Stream IDs on this pin.

param.name: ppIEnumStreamIdMap
param.para: interface pointer that will be set to the returned collection.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Currently, there is only one stream ID mapped to a given pin, therefore this collection will contain a single item.

summary.para: The MapStreamId method maps the Stream ID of an elementary stream within an MPEG-2 program stream to a media content type and substream filtering information.

param.name: ulStreamId
param.para: The stream ID of the PES stream.

param.name: MediaSampleContent
param.para: Specifies the contents of the stream. Currently the only value supported is MPEG2_PROGRAM_ELEMENTARY_STREAM (defined as 0x00000001 in axextend.idl).

param.name: ulSubstreamFilterValue
param.para: Specifies which substream within this elementary stream to pass on to the downstream decoder. Only the low-order byte can contain a valid filter value. If iDataOffset = 0, this parameter is ignored.

param.name: iDataOffset
param.para: The byte offset into the payload at which the substream begins.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, an error code is returned. If a Stream ID of MEDIA_PROGRAM_STREAM_MAP, MEDIA_PROGRAM_DIRECTORY_PES_PACKET or MEDIA_PROGRAM_PACK_HEADER is attempted, this method returns E_NOTIMPL.

remarks.para: The Stream ID mapped by this method is the stream ID in the PES header. Substream filtering is most commonly used to provide multiple channels on a single audio stream.

summary.para: The UnmapStreamId method unmaps the Stream ID mapping created in a previous call to MapStreamId.

param.name: culStreamId
param.para: The number of elements in the pulStreamID array.

param.name: pulStreamId
param.para: Array of Stream IDs mapped for this pin.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: There is typically only one stream ID mapped to a given pin, therefore pulStreamID will typically contain a single element.

summary.para: This interface is implemented on each output pin of the MPEG-2 Demultiplexer filter (Demux) and is used in program stream mode only. It is called by applications or other filters to associate the pin with a specified Stream ID and to inform the pin whether substream filtering is required on the stream. This interface is not exposed when the filter is playing back a file (pull-mode).
For transport streams, use the IMPEG2PIDMap interface.
